snippet: The former Jets linebacker Ikemefuna Enemkpali was embarrassed when Geno Smith failed to attend Enemkpali’s Texas football camp. The perceived slight simmered until it exploded.
abstract: Buffalo Bills linebacker Ikemefuna Enemkpali, who was dropped by New York Jets after breaking jaw of starting quarterback Geno Smith in locker-room altercation, is described by those who knew him in high school and college as even-tempered, loyal and humble; details of fight are unclear, but dispute stemmed from Smith's broken promise to attend Enemkpali's instructional football camp for children in his hometown Pflugerville, Tex, and unwillingness to pay back related expenses.
lead_paragraph: The former Jets linebacker Ikemefuna Enemkpali was embarrassed when Geno Smith failed to attend Enemkpali’s Texas football camp. The perceived slight simmered until it exploded.

headline.main: Raised to Be Respectful, Ikemefuna Enemkpali Lets a Dispute Get the Better of Him
headline.print_headline: The Undoing of a Quiet Jet
